pullRequest.body:
This is a substantial step on the way to PNT and Dirichlet's Theorem: it adds the fact that the L-function of a Dirichlet character does not vanish on the closed right half-plane `Re(s) ≥ 1`.

From [EulerProducts](https://github.com/MichaelStollBayreuth/EulerProducts).

See [here](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/144837-PR-reviews/topic/Prerequisites.20for.20PNT.20and.20Dirichlet's.20Thm/near/482385971) on Zulip.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [032d02a2b7](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/19043/commits/032d02a2b77cae3600c6b3129a2935e4eee2af7d)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.NumberTheory.LSeries.Nonvanishing`|2415|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ LFunctionTrivChar_isBigO_near_one_horizontal`
`+ LFunction_apply_one_ne_zero`
`+ LFunction_isBigO_horizontal`
`+ LFunction_ne_zero_of_one_le_re`
`+ LFunction_ne_zero_of_re_eq_one`
`+ norm_LFunction_product_ge_one`
`+ norm_LSeries_product_ge_one`
`+ riemannZeta_ne_zero_of_one_le_re`
`+ summable_neg_log_one_sub_mul_prime_cpow`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
</details>

> Here are some comments. Didn't quite get to the end (my train is about to arrive).
> 
> General remark on the end: is it worth having separate lemmas for the specific non-vanishing at `s = 1` as well as the general `re s = 1` statement?

@loefflerd Thanks! It is amazing how much room for improvement there still is :smile: 

If you think it makes sense having a separate lemma for the special case `s = 1`, I can of course easily add it. Do you have some specific use case in mind?

> If you think it makes sense having a separate lemma for the special case s = 1, I can of course easily add it. Do you have some specific use case in mind?

Orders of vanishing of L-series at integers are, let's say,  interesting in certain contexts :-)

OK; added `DirichletCharacter.Lfunction_apply_one_ne_zero`.

Regarding merging `QuadraticNonvanishing` into this file: as the main result there will end up a special case of this newly added result, I propose to make everything coming from there `private` (in the follow-up PR merging the files). Any objections?
@loefflerd Did you have time to look at the remainder of the file?

Looks great now, thanks!

maintainer merge
🚀 Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by loefflerd.

This is great, thanks a lot!

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11887891501/job/33121400222)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11887891501/job/33121400696)
Here are some comments on the last part of the file.

Here are some comments. Didn't quite get to the end (my train is about to arrive).

General remark on the end: is it worth having separate lemmas for the specific non-vanishing at `s = 1` as well as the general `re s = 1` statement?
Here are some comments on the last part of the file.
I think we don't need two separate files for the non-quadratic and quadratic result; we should delete the `QuadraticNonvanishing` file and move its contents to here.
OK, but this is probably better done in a separate follow-up PR.

alternative:
```suggestion
  rw [← ((hasSum_re <| hasSum_taylorSeries_neg_log hac₀).mul_left 3).add
    ((hasSum_re <| hasSum_taylorSeries_neg_log hac₁).mul_left 4) |>.add
    (hasSum_re <| hasSum_taylorSeries_neg_log hac₂) |>.tsum_eq]
```

```suggestion
  · simp only [pow_zero, Nat.cast_zero, div_zero, mul_zero, one_re, mul_one, add_zero, le_refl]
```
Our old friend `CharP.cast_eq_zero` ...

alternative (not clear if it's actually better):
```suggestion
    convert (show 0 ≤ 2 * a ^ n * ((z ^ n).re + 1) ^ 2 by positivity) using 1
    ring
```
It saves a line is certainly not worse.

better:
```suggestion
  · simp only [MulChar.map_nonunit _ hn', zero_mul, sub_zero, log_one, neg_zero, zero_re, mul_zero,
      neg_add_rev, add_zero, pow_two, le_refl]
```

```suggestion
    simpa only [norm_mul, norm_natCast_cpow_of_re_ne_zero _ <| re_neg_ne_zero_of_one_lt_re hs]
      using mul_le_of_le_one_left (by positivity) (χ.norm_le_one _)
```

```suggestion
    · simp only [ofReal_cpow n.cast_nonneg (-x), ofReal_natCast, ofReal_neg] 
```
If you hover over the lemma name, the docstring is displayed with the latex un-processed, so I think using unicode text would be better.
Will do.

golf:
```suggestion
  simpa only [neg_add_rev, neg_re, mul_neg, χ.pow_apply' two_ne_zero, ge_iff_le, add_re, one_re,
    ofReal_re, ofReal_add, ofReal_one] using
      tsum_nonneg fun (p : Nat.Primes) ↦ χ.re_log_comb_nonneg p.prop.two_le h₀ y
```

using transitivity and reflexivity together is redundant!
```suggestion
    exact ((isBigO_mul_iff_isBigO_div eventually_mem_nhdsWithin).mp <| H.isBigO_one ℂ)
```

```suggestion
      · simpa only [tendsto_iff_comap, Homeomorph.coe_addLeft, add_zero, map_le_iff_le_comap] using
          ((Homeomorph.addLeft (1 : ℂ)).map_punctured_nhds_eq 0).le
```

```suggestion
      · simp only [Function.comp_def, add_sub_cancel_left]
```

```suggestion
    have H : Tendsto (fun w ↦ w * LFunctionTrivChar N (1 + w)) (𝓝[≠] 0)
        (𝓝 <| ∏ p ∈ N.primeFactors, (1 - (p : ℂ)⁻¹)) := by
```
(always use an even indent depth)

```suggestion
    exact (isBigO_mul_iff_isBigO_div eventually_mem_nhdsWithin).mp <| H.isBigO_one ℂ
```
This lemma should be private, since once the argument is concluded we'll have shown that the hypotheses can't be satisfied.

```suggestion
    refine h.symm.imp_right (fun h H ↦ ?_)
```
(equivalent but more readable)

The implication "true => frequently true" holds whether or not the filter is \bot:
```suggestion
  exact isLittleO_irrefl (.of_forall (fun _ ↦ one_ne_zero)) <| H.of_norm_right.trans_isLittleO 
    <| isLittleO_id_one.mono nhdsWithin_le_nhds
```

```suggestion
theorem LFunction_ne_zero_of_re_eq_one {s : ℂ} (hs : s.re = 1) (hχs : χ ≠ 1 ∨ s ≠ 1) :
```
(and similarly in other lemmas below)
(as above)

There is no `z` here. Also the hypothesis `hz` is redundant because of docs#riemannZeta_one_ne_zero. I know it's not a mathematically interesting statement, but it means one fewer hypothesis to verify. 

(We could even add a little argument to show non-vanishing at `s = 1` for the trivial character modulo `N > 1`, using that the factor relating the L-series of the trivial char mod N to `riemannZeta` is non-vanishing outside s = 0. But we can leave that for another PR if you prefer.)

I had changed `z` into `s` earlier, but forgot to change the names of the assumptions, too.

I think I would like to leave removing the `χ ≠ 1` assumption in the previous lemma for a separate PR.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(NumberTheory/LSeries/Nonvanishing): new file
